data.name: Dialga
data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

data.name: Dusknoir
data.flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

abilities.name: Dark Palm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, you may choose 1 of them and shuffle that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. This power can't be used if Dusknoir if affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hard Feelings
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. Then, count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken and put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Electivire
data.flavorText: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

abilities.name: Intense Voltage
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Elekid is anywhere under Electivire, you may move a Lightning Energy attached to your Pokémon to Electivire. This power can't be used if Electivire is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electivire. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.name: Infernape
data.flavorText: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.

attacks.name: Meteor Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Infernape.

data.name: Empoleon
data.flavorText: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.

abilities.name: Gleam Eyes
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Luxray from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent's Bench isn't full, choose 1 Basic Pokémon from your opponent's hand, and put it onto his or her Bench. Then, switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Star
attacks.text: Move all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Manaphy
data.flavorText: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: Switch Manaphy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Mismagius
data.flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.

attacks.name: Avenge
attacks.text: Count the number of your Pokémon that have any damage counters on them. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Palkia
data.flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Transback
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.name: Magnezone
data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

abilities.name: Magnetize
abilities.text: If you have any Metal Energy attached to your Active Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for that Pokémon is 0.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

abilities.name: Earth Fissure
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Rhyperior from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Rhyperior can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Roserade
data.flavorText: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spike Whip
attacks.text: If Budew is anywhere under Roserade, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Staraptor
data.flavorText: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.

attacks.name: Accelerative Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all damage done to Staraptor by attacks (both yours and your opponent's) until the end of your next turn.

attacks.name: Brave Heart
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Staraptor does 100 damage to itself.

data.name: Shiftry
data.flavorText: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

abilities.name: Darkness Fan
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Evolved Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon, and put it back into his or her hand. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spirit Dance
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Skuntank
data.flavorText: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Toxic Cloud
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Torterra
data.flavorText: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leaf Storm
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Grass Pokémon.

data.name: Beautifly
data.flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Beautifly the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Azumarill during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bubble Pump
attacks.text: If Azumarill has 3 or more Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If Azurill is anywhere under Azumarill, flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bibarel
data.flavorText: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Bibarel. Bibarel is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Bibarel does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Drapion
data.flavorText: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Carnivine
data.flavorText: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Carnivine. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Carnivine's, this attack does 60 damage instead.

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

attacks.name: Wind Wave
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 in any combination of Pokémon and Supporter cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Explosive Smoke
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Clefable
data.flavorText: Rarely seen by people, it is said to be drawn by the full moon to play at deserted lakes.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) Clefable performs that attack.

data.name: Floatzel
data.flavorText: It floats using its well-developed floatation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Floatzel but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.name: Dustox
data.flavorText: A nocturnal Pokémon. Drawn by streetlights, they messily eat the leaves of trees lining boulevards.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Dust
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.flavorText: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

attacks.name: Vacuum Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sand Eject
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Heracross
data.flavorText: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It's strong enough to hurl foes.

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools that area by nearly 10 degrees F.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counter on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Shadow Dance
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. Then, switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Lopunny
data.flavorText: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

attacks.name: Healing Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Remove a number of damage counters equal to the number of heads from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flop
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may switch Lopunny with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Munchlax
data.flavorText: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.name: Heave
attacks.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, this attack does nothing.) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pachirisu does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.

attacks.name: See Beyond
attacks.text: Choose a card from your hand and put it as a Prize card face up. Then, choose 1 of your face-down Prize cards without looking and put it into your hand. This attack does nothing if all of your Prize cards are face up.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.name: Machamp
data.flavorText: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it has honed its sixth sense. Its movements are elegant.

attacks.name: Force Palm
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on Medicham. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Kick
attacks.text: Medicham does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.

attacks.name: Block
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ease Up
attacks.text: Snorlax is now Asleep. If Snorlax is evolved from Munchlax, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Metal Slash
attacks.text: Steelix can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Purugly
data.flavorText: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.

attacks.name: High Hat
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.

attacks.name: Leaf Honey
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy attached to Vespiquen and remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Attack Order
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Grass Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.flavorText: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.

attacks.name: Countercharge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, move all damage counters from Wobbuffet to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Budew
data.flavorText: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Roselia from your hand onto Budew (this counts as evolving Budew) and remove all damage counters from Budew.

attacks.name: Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Wynaut
data.flavorText: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut) and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Cascoon
data.flavorText: It is hot inside its cocoon. All the cells in its body create the energy for it to evolve.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Cascoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Cascoon if that damage is 30 or less.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cherrim
data.flavorText: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from Cherrim.

data.name: Elekid
data.flavorText: It generates electricity by whirling its arms. However, it can't store the energy it makes.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Outlet
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Dusclops
data.flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.

attacks.name: Roam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gravity Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that doesn't have a Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

attacks.name: Blowing Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ominous Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Grotle
data.flavorText: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Monferno
data.flavorText: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.

attacks.name: Flame Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Monferno.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Magnetic Ray
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it and switch that Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Mantyke
data.flavorText: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mantine from your hand onto Mantyke (this counts as evolving Mantyke) and remove all damage counters from Mantyke.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Prinplup
data.flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

attacks.name: Aqua Shower
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Brine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: MACHOKE's boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

attacks.name: Dirty Trick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Rapidash
data.flavorText: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blaze Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.

attacks.name: Storm Up
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Crash Impact
attacks.text: Rhydon does 10 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Seaking.

data.name: Silcoon
data.flavorText: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, If Silcoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Silcoon if that damage is 30 or less.

attacks.name: Entangling String
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Unown A
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

abilities.name: ANALYZE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown A is on your Bench, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.name: Staravia
data.flavorText: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Unown B
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

abilities.name: BOUNCE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown B is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard all cards attached to any 1 of your Unown and shuffle that Pokémon back into your deck.

data.name: Unown C
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

abilities.name: CALL
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown C is on your Bench, you may flip coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 Unown and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Azurill
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts a evolving Azurill) and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Delivery
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Unown D
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

abilities.name: DRAW
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown D is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, each player may draw a card. (You draw your card first.)

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

data.name: Bonsly
data.flavorText: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body's fluid levels by eliminating excess.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Sudowoodo from your hand onto Bonsly (this counts as evolving Bonsly) and remove all damage counters from Bonsly.

attacks.name: Fake Tears
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn, and any damage done to Bonsly by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.

attacks.name: Splash About
attacks.text: If Buizel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Buneary
data.flavorText: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

attacks.name: Jump Kick
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack does any damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Cherubi.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

data.name: Clefairy
data.flavorText: Thought to live with others on quiet mountains, it is popular for its adorable nature.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Moon Impact
attacks.text: If Clefairy is evolved from Cleffa, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Cleffa
data.flavorText: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Clefairy from your hand onto Cleffa (this counts as evolving Cleffa) and remove all damage counters from Cleffa.

attacks.name: Eeek
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.

attacks.name: Soliciting Nectar
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Duskull
data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Night Shade
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Electabuzz
data.flavorText: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Shock Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If Electabuzz is evolved from Elekid, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.

attacks.name: Pain Payback
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from Gastly to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Goldeen does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Glameow
data.flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness if very popular among some.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pose
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Kick Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

data.name: Magnemite
data.flavorText: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Resonance
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow on river bottoms.

attacks.name: Rollout
attacks.text: If Marill is evolved from Azurill, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: Switch Marill with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Meditite during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Mime Jr.
data.flavorText: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Mime
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Ponyta
data.flavorText: About an hour after birth, its fiery mane and tail grow out, giving it an impressive appearance.

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Roselia
data.flavorText: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.

attacks.name: Toxic Spikes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Roselia is evolved from Budew, this attack does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sweet Spike
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Skorupi
data.flavorText: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Seedot
data.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Seedot would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Seedot is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Starly
data.flavorText: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a STARLY, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

data.name: Stunky
data.flavorText: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Severe Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Double Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Night Pokémon Center
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, remove all damage counters from that Pokémon. If both are tails, discard all Energy cards attached to that Pokémon.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.
If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Pokédex HANDY910is
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Professor Rowan
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose 1 card in your hand and shuffle the rest of your cards into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

data.name: Speed Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Once during each player's turn, the player may flip a coin until he or she gets tails. For each heads, that player draws a card.

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Rival
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Your opponent chooses 3 of those cards. Put those cards into your hand and put other 2 cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Warp Point
rules: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Potion
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 damage counter if that Pokémon has only 1).

data.name: Empoleon LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Empoleon. Empoleon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Supreme Command
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your opponent's hand without looking and put them face down next to the Defending Pokémon. (These cards are not in play or in your opponent's hand.) At the end of your opponent's next turn, return those cards to your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Empoleon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to that Pokémon (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Infernape LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Infernape. Infernape LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Burning Head
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Discard the other 2 cards. This power can't be used if Infernape is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flare Up
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for 8 Fire Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck. (This attack does nothing if you don't have 8 Fire Energy cards in your discard pile.)

data.name: Torterra LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Torterra. Torterra LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Forest Murmurs
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Torterra is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Vigorous Dash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Torterra does 30 damage to itself.
